name: ArchiveRemoteFolder
description: Run a PowerShell script to archive a remote folder.
author: ggarbuglia

inputs.name: server
inputs.label: Remote Machine
inputs.helpMarkDown: FQDN of the remote machine you want to reach.

inputs.name: adminusr
inputs.label: Admin Login
inputs.helpMarkDown: Administrator login for the remote machine.

inputs.name: adminpwd
inputs.label: Admin Password
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Password for administrator login for the remote machine.
It can accept variable defined in Build/Release definitions as '$(passwordVariable)'.
You may mark variable type as 'secret' to secure it.

inputs.name: sourcepath
inputs.label: Source Path
inputs.helpMarkDown: A local path on the remote server.

inputs.name: targetpath
inputs.label: Target Path
inputs.helpMarkDown: A local path on the remote server or a network share where the user has write permissions.

inputs.name: filename
inputs.label: 7z Filename
inputs.helpMarkDown: The archive file name (with or without extension).

inputs.name: datestampformat
inputs.label: Date Stamp Format
inputs.helpMarkDown: The archive file name datetime format.

inputs.name: retensiondays
inputs.label: Retension Days
inputs.helpMarkDown: The archive folder retension in days (0 = retain all).
